member.summary: JPEG file with CMYK.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.ImageInformation.HorizontalDPI
member.summary: The horizontal DPI (dots per inch). Can be 0 if not supported by the image format. Note: JFIF (JPEG) files may contain either DPI or DPM or just the aspect ratio. Windows BMP files will contain DPM. Other formats may support any combination, including none at all.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.ImageInformation.VerticalDPI
member.summary: The vertical DPI (dots per inch). Can be 0 if not supported by the image format.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.ImageInformation.HorizontalDPM
member.summary: The horizontal DPM (dots per meter). Can be 0 if not supported by the image format.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.ImageInformation.VerticalDPM
member.summary: The vertical DPM (dots per meter). Can be 0 if not supported by the image format.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.ImageInformation.HorizontalAspectRatio
member.summary: The horizontal component of the aspect ratio. Can be 0 if not supported by the image format. Note: Aspect ratio will be set if either DPI or DPM was set, but may also be available in the absence of both DPI and DPM.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.ImageInformation.VerticalAspectRatio
member.summary: The vertical component of the aspect ratio. Can be 0 if not supported by the image format.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.ImageInformation.ColorsUsed
member.summary: The colors used. Only valid for images with palettes, will be 0 otherwise.

member.summary: Specifies how the content of an existing PDF page and new content is combined.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XGraphicsPdfPageOptions.Append
member.summary: The new content is inserted behind the old content and any subsequent drawing in done above the existing graphic.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XGraphicsPdfPageOptions.Prepend
member.summary: The new content is inserted before the old content and any subsequent drawing in done beneath the existing graphic.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XGraphicsPdfPageOptions.Replace
member.summary: The new content entirely replaces the old content and any subsequent drawing in done on a blank page.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Drawing.XLineAlignment
member.summary: Specifies the alignment of a text string relative to its layout rectangle

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XLineAlignment.Near
member.summary: Specifies the text be aligned near the layout. In a left-to-right layout, the near position is left. In a right-to-left layout, the near position is right.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XLineAlignment.Center
member.summary: Specifies that text is aligned in the center of the layout rectangle.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XLineAlignment.Far
member.summary: Specifies that text is aligned far from the origin position of the layout rectangle. In a left-to-right layout, the far position is right. In a right-to-left layout, the far position is left.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XLineAlignment.BaseLine
member.summary: Specifies that text is aligned relative to its base line. With this option the layout rectangle must have a height of 0.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Drawing.XLinearGradientMode
member.summary: Specifies the direction of a linear gradient.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XLinearGradientMode.Horizontal
member.summary: Specifies a gradient from left to right.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XLinearGradientMode.Vertical
member.summary: Specifies a gradient from top to bottom.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XLinearGradientMode.ForwardDiagonal
member.summary: Specifies a gradient from upper left to lower right.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XLinearGradientMode.BackwardDiagonal
member.summary: Specifies a gradient from upper right to lower left.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Drawing.XLineCap
member.summary: Specifies the available cap styles with which an XPen object can start and end a line.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XLineCap.Flat
member.summary: Specifies a flat line cap.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XLineCap.Round
member.summary: Specifies a round line cap.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XLineCap.Square
member.summary: Specifies a square line cap.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Drawing.XLineJoin
member.summary: Specifies how to join consecutive line or curve segments in a figure or subpath.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XLineJoin.Miter
member.summary: Specifies a mitered join. This produces a sharp corner or a clipped corner, depending on whether the length of the miter exceeds the miter limit

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XLineJoin.Round
member.summary: Specifies a circular join. This produces a smooth, circular arc between the lines.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XLineJoin.Bevel
member.summary: Specifies a beveled join. This produces a diagonal corner.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Drawing.XMatrixOrder
member.summary: Specifies the order for matrix transform operations.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XMatrixOrder.Prepend
member.summary: The new operation is applied before the old operation.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XMatrixOrder.Append
member.summary: The new operation is applied after the old operation.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Drawing.XPageDirection
member.summary: Specifies the direction of the y-axis.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XPageDirection.Downwards
member.summary: Increasing Y values go downwards. This is the default.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XPageDirection.Upwards
member.summary: Increasing Y values go upwards. This is only possible when drawing on a PDF page. It is not implemented when drawing on a System.Drawing.Graphics object.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Drawing.XSmoothingMode
member.summary: Specifies whether smoothing (or antialiasing) is applied to lines and curves and the edges of filled areas.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XSmoothingMode.Invalid
member.summary: Specifies an invalid mode.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XSmoothingMode.Default
member.summary: Specifies the default mode.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XStringAlignment.Near
member.summary: Specifies the text be aligned near the layout. In a left-to-right layout, the near position is left. In a right-to-left layout, the near position is right.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XStringAlignment.Center
member.summary: Specifies that text is aligned in the center of the layout rectangle.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.Drawing.XStringAlignment.Far
member.summary: Specifies that text is aligned far from the origin position of the layout rectangle. In a left-to-right layout, the far position is right. In a right-to-left layout, the far position is left.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor
member.summary: Represents a RGB, CMYK, or gray scale color.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.FromArgb(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an XColor structure from a 32-bit ARGB value.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.FromArgb(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Creates an XColor structure from a 32-bit ARGB value.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.FromArgb(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an XColor structure from the specified 8-bit color values (red, green, and blue). The alpha value is implicitly 255 (fully opaque).

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.FromArgb(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an XColor structure from the four ARGB component (alpha, red, green, and blue) values.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.FromArgb(System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Creates an XColor structure from the specified System.Drawing.Color.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.FromArgb(System.Int32,PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor)
member.summary: Creates an XColor structure from the specified alpha value and color.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.FromArgb(System.Int32,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Creates an XColor structure from the specified alpha value and color.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.FromCmyk(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates an XColor structure from the specified CMYK values.

member.summary: Creates an XColor structure from the specified CMYK values.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.FromGrayScale(System.Double)
member.summary: Creates an XColor structure from the specified gray value.

member.summary: Creates an XColor from the specified pre-defined color.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.FromKnownColor(System.Drawing.KnownColor)
member.summary: Creates an XColor from the specified pre-defined color.

member.summary: Creates an XColor from the specified name of a pre-defined color.

member.summary: Gets or sets the color space to be used for PDF generation.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.IsEmpty
member.summary: Indicates whether this XColor structure is uninitialized.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.op_Implicit(System.Drawing.Color)~PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor
member.summary: Implicit conversion from Color to XColor

member.summary: Creates a System.Drawing.Color object from this color.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified object is a Color structure and is equivalent to this Color structure.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hash code for this instance.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.op_Equality(PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor,PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor)
member.summary: Determines whether two colors are equal.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.op_Inequality(PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor,PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor)
member.summary: Determines whether two colors are not equal.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.IsKnownColor
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this color is a known color.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.GetHue
member.summary: Gets the hue-saturation-brightness (HSB) hue value, in degrees, for this color.
member.returns: The hue, in degrees, of this color. The hue is measured in degrees, ranging from 0 through 360, in HSB color space.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.GetSaturation
member.summary: Gets the hue-saturation-brightness (HSB) saturation value for this color.
member.returns: The saturation of this color. The saturation ranges from 0 through 1, where 0 is grayscale and 1 is the most saturated.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.GetBrightness
member.summary: Gets the hue-saturation-brightness (HSB) brightness value for this color.
member.returns: The brightness of this color. The brightness ranges from 0 through 1, where 0 represents black and 1 represents white.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.RgbChanged
member.summary: One of the RGB values changed; recalculate other color representations.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.CmykChanged
member.summary: One of the CMYK values changed; recalculate other color representations.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.GrayChanged
member.summary: The gray scale value changed; recalculate other color representations.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.A
member.summary: Gets or sets the alpha value the specifies the transparency. The value is in the range from 1 (opaque) to 0 (completely transparent).

member.summary: Gets or sets the red value.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.G
member.summary: Gets or sets the green value.

member.summary: Gets or sets the blue value.

member.summary: Gets the RGB part value of the color. Internal helper function.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.Argb
member.summary: Gets the ARGB part value of the color. Internal helper function.

member.summary: Gets or sets the cyan value.

member.summary: Gets or sets the magenta value.

member.summary: Gets or sets the yellow value.

member.summary: Gets or sets the black (or key) value.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Drawing.XColor.GS
member.summary: Gets or sets the gray scale value.

The XGraphics object used for drawing the content is disposed by this function and cannot be used for any further drawing operations. member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XGraphics.ShearTransform(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Applies the specified shearing operation to the transformation matrix of this object by prepending it to the object's transformation matrix. ShearTransform is a synonym for SkewAtTransform. Parameter shearX specifies the horizontal skew which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the y-axis. Parameter shearY specifies the vertical skew which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the x-axis.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XGraphics.ShearTransform(System.Double,System.Double,PdfEdit.Drawing.XMatrixOrder)
member.summary: Applies the specified shearing operation to the transformation matrix of this object in the specified order. ShearTransform is a synonym for SkewAtTransform. Parameter shearX specifies the horizontal skew which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the y-axis. Parameter shearY specifies the vertical skew which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the x-axis.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XGraphics.SkewAtTransform(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Applies the specified shearing operation to the transformation matrix of this object by prepending it to the object's transformation matrix. ShearTransform is a synonym for SkewAtTransform. Parameter shearX specifies the horizontal skew which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the y-axis. Parameter shearY specifies the vertical skew which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the x-axis.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XGraphics.SkewAtTransform(System.Double,System.Double,PdfEdit.Drawing.XPoint)
member.summary: Applies the specified shearing operation to the transformation matrix of this object by prepending it to the object's transformation matrix. ShearTransform is a synonym for SkewAtTransform. Parameter shearX specifies the horizontal skew which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the y-axis. Parameter shearY specifies the vertical skew which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the x-axis.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XGraphicsPath.SimulateBaselineOffset(PdfEdit.Drawing.XFontFamily,PdfEdit.Drawing.XFontStyle,System.Double,PdfEdit.Drawing.XStringFormat)
member.summary: Calculates the offset for BaseLine positioning simulation: In GDI we have only Near, Center and Far as LineAlignment and no BaseLine. For XLineAlignment.BaseLine StringAlignment.Near is returned. We now return the negative drawed ascender height. This has to be added to the LayoutRect/Origin before each _gdipPath.AddString().

member.name: T:PdfEdit.Drawing.XPdfForm
member.summary: Represents a so called 'PDF form external object', which is typically an imported page of an external PDF document. XPdfForm objects are used like images to draw an existing PDF page of an external document in the current document. XPdfForm objects can only be placed in PDF documents. If you try to draw them using a XGraphics based on an GDI+ context no action is taken if no placeholder image is specified. Otherwise the place holder is drawn.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XPdfForm.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the XPdfForm class from the specified path to an external PDF document. Although PDFEdit internally caches XPdfForm objects it is recommended to reuse XPdfForm objects in your code and change the PageNumber property if more than one page is needed form the external document. Furthermore, because XPdfForm can occupy very much memory, it is recommended to dispose XPdfForm objects if not needed anymore.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XPdfForm.#ctor(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from a stream.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XPdfForm.FromFile(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an XPdfForm from a file.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XPdfForm.FromStream(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Creates an XPdfForm from a stream.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XPdfForm.Finish
member.summary: Sets the form in the state FormState.Finished.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XPdfForm.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Frees the memory occupied by the underlying imported PDF document, even if other XPdfForm objects refer to this document. A reuse of this object doesn't fail, because the underlying PDF document is re-imported if necessary.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Drawing.XPdfForm.PlaceHolder
member.summary: Gets or sets an image that is used for drawing if the current XGraphics object cannot handle PDF forms. A place holder is useful for showing a preview of a page on the display, because PDFEdit cannot render native PDF objects.

member.summary: Gets or sets the transformation matrix.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Drawing.XPdfForm.PageNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets the page number in the external PDF document this object refers to. The page number is one-based, i.e. it is in the range from 1 to PageCount. The default value is 1.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Drawing.XPdfForm.PageIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the page index in the external PDF document this object refers to. The page index is zero-based, i.e. it is in the range from 0 to PageCount - 1. The default value is 0.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.Drawing.XPdfForm.ExternalDocument
member.summary: Gets the underlying document from which pages are imported.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.Drawing.XPdfForm.ExtractPageNumber(System.String,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Extracts the page number if the path has the form 'MyFile.pdf#123' and returns the actual path without the number sign and the following digits.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Checksums.Adler32
member.summary:
Computes Adler32 checksum for a stream of data. An Adler32 checksum is not as reliable as a CRC32 checksum, but a lot faster to compute.
The specification for Adler32 may be found in RFC 1950. ZLIB Compressed Data Format Specification version 3.3)
From that document:
"ADLER32 (Adler-32 checksum) This contains a checksum value of the uncompressed data (excluding any dictionary data) computed according to Adler-32 algorithm. This algorithm is a 32-bit extension and improvement of the Fletcher algorithm, used in the ITU-T X.224 / ISO 8073 standard.
Adler-32 is composed of two sums accumulated per byte: s1 is the sum of all bytes, s2 is the sum of all s1 values. Both sums are done modulo 65521. s1 is initialized to 1, s2 to zero. The Adler-32 checksum is stored as s2*65536 + s1 in most- significant-byte first (network) order."
"8.2. The Adler-32 algorithm
The Adler-32 algorithm is much faster than the CRC32 algorithm yet still provides an extremely low probability of undetected errors.
The modulo on unsigned long accumulators can be delayed for 5552 bytes, so the modulo operation time is negligible. If the bytes are a, b, c, the second sum is 3a + 2b + c + 3, and so is position and order sensitive, unlike the first sum, which is just a checksum. That 65521 is prime is important to avoid a possible large class of two-byte errors that leave the check unchanged. (The Fletcher checksum uses 255, which is not prime and which also makes the Fletcher check insensitive to single byte changes 0 - 255.)
The sum s1 is initialized to 1 instead of zero to make the length of the sequence part of s2, so that the length does not have to be checked separately. (Any sequence of zeroes has a Fletcher checksum of zero.)"

member.name: T:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Checksums.Crc32
member.summary:
Generate a table for a byte-wise 32-bit CRC calculation on the polynomial: x^32+x^26+x^23+x^22+x^16+x^12+x^11+x^10+x^8+x^7+x^5+x^4+x^2+x+1.
Polynomials over GF(2) are represented in binary, one bit per coefficient, with the lowest powers in the most significant bit. Then adding polynomials is just exclusive-or, and multiplying a polynomial by x is a right shift by one. If we call the above polynomial p, and represent a byte as the polynomial q, also with the lowest power in the most significant bit (so the byte 0xb1 is the polynomial x^7+x^3+x+1), then the CRC is (q*x^32) mod p, where a mod b means the remainder after dividing a by b.
This calculation is done using the shift-register method of multiplying and taking the remainder. The register is initialized to zero, and for each incoming bit, x^32 is added mod p to the register if the bit is a one (where x^32 mod p is p+x^32 = x^26+...+1), and the register is multiplied mod p by x (which is shifting right by one and adding x^32 mod p if the bit shifted out is a one). We start with the highest power (least significant bit) of q and repeat for all eight bits of q.
The table is simply the CRC of all possible eight bit values. This is all the information needed to generate CRC's on data a byte at a time for all combinations of CRC register values and incoming bytes.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater
member.summary:
This is the Deflater class. The deflater class compresses input with the deflate algorithm described in RFC 1951. It has several compression levels and three different strategies described below.
This class is not thread safe. This is inherent in the API, due to the split of deflate and setInput.
Author of the original java version: Jochen Hoenicke

member.name: F:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.BEST_COMPRESSION
member.summary: The best and slowest compression level. This tries to find very long and distant string repetitions.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.BEST_SPEED
member.summary: The worst but fastest compression level.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.DEFAULT_COMPRESSION
member.summary: The default compression level.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.NO_COMPRESSION
member.summary: This level won't compress at all but output uncompressed blocks.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.DEFLATED
member.summary: The compression method. This is the only method supported so far. There is no need to use this constant at all.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new deflater with default compression level.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new deflater with given compression level.
member.param: the compression level, a value between NO_COMPRESSION and BEST_COMPRESSION, or DEFAULT_COMPRESSION.
member.exception: if lvl is out of range.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new deflater with given compression level.
member.param: the compression level, a value between NO_COMPRESSION and BEST_COMPRESSION.
true, if we should suppress the Zlib/RFC1950 header at the beginning and the adler checksum at the end of the output. This is useful for the GZIP/PKZIP formats.
member.exception: if lvl is out of range.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.Reset
member.summary: Resets the deflater. The deflater acts afterwards as if it was just created with the same compression level and strategy as it had before.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.Adler
member.summary: Gets the current adler checksum of the data that was processed so far.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.TotalIn
member.summary: Gets the number of input bytes processed so far.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.TotalOut
member.summary: Gets the number of output bytes so far.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.Flush
member.summary: Flushes the current input block. Further calls to deflate() will produce enough output to inflate everything in the current input block. This is not part of Sun's JDK so I have made it package private. It is used by DeflaterOutputStream to implement flush().

member.name: M:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.Finish
member.summary: Finishes the deflater with the current input block. It is an error to give more input after this method was called. This method must be called to force all bytes to be flushed.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.IsFinished
member.summary: Returns true if the stream was finished and no more output bytes are available.

member.name: P:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.IsNeedingInput
member.summary: Returns true, if the input buffer is empty. You should then call setInput(). NOTE: This method can also return true when the stream was finished.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.SetInput(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Sets the data which should be compressed next. This should be only called when needsInput indicates that more input is needed. If you call setInput when needsInput() returns false, the previous input that is still pending will be thrown away. The given byte array should not be changed, before needsInput() returns true again. This call is equivalent to setInput(input, 0, input.length).
member.param: the buffer containing the input data.
member.exception: if the buffer was finished() or ended().

member.name: M:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.SetInput(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the data which should be compressed next. This should be only called when needsInput indicates that more input is needed. The given byte array should not be changed, before needsInput() returns true again.
member.param: the buffer containing the input data.
the number of data bytes of input.
member.exception: if the buffer was Finish()ed or if previous input is still pending.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.SetLevel(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the compression level. There is no guarantee of the exact position of the change, but if you call this when needsInput is true the change of compression level will occur somewhere near before the end of the so far given input.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.GetLevel
member.summary: Get current compression level
member.returns: Returns the current compression level

member.name: M:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.SetStrategy(PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.DeflateStrategy)
member.summary: Sets the compression strategy. Strategy is one of DEFAULT_STRATEGY, HUFFMAN_ONLY and FILTERED. For the exact position where the strategy is changed, the same as for SetLevel() applies.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.Deflate(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Deflates the current input block with to the given array.
member.param: The buffer where compressed data is stored
member.returns: The number of compressed bytes added to the output, or 0 if either IsNeedingInput() or IsFinished returns true or length is zero.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.Deflate(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Deflates the current input block to the given array.
member.param: Buffer to store the compressed data.
The maximum number of bytes that may be stored.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.SetDictionary(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the dictionary which should be used in the deflate process. The dictionary is a byte array containing strings that are likely to occur in the data which should be compressed. The dictionary is not stored in the compressed output, only a checksum. To decompress the output you need to supply the same dictionary again.
member.param: The index where dictionary information commences.
The number of bytes in the dictionary.
member.exception: If SetInput () or Deflate() were already called or another dictionary was already set.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.DeflaterEngine.head
member.summary: Hashtable, hashing three characters to an index for window, so that window[index]..window[index+2] have this hash code. Note that the array should really be unsigned short, so you need to and the values with 0xffff.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.DeflaterEngine.prev
member.summary: prev[index & WMASK] points to the previous index that has the same hash code as the string starting at index. This way entries with the same hash code are in a linked list. Note that the array should really be unsigned short, so you need to and the values with 0xffff.

member.summary: Points to the current character in the window.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.DeflaterEngine.lookahead
member.summary: lookahead is the number of characters starting at strstart in window that are valid. So window[strstart] until window[strstart+lookahead-1] are valid characters.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.DeflaterEngine.window
member.summary: This array contains the part of the uncompressed stream that is of relevance. The current character is indexed by strstart.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Inflater
member.summary:
Inflater is used to decompress data that has been compressed according to the "deflate" standard described in rfc1951.
By default Zlib (rfc1950) headers and footers are expected in the input. You can use constructor public Inflater(bool noHeader) passing true if there is no Zlib header information
The usage is as following. First you have to set some input with SetInput(), then Inflate() it. If inflate doesn't inflate any bytes there may be three reasons:
IsNeedingInput() returns true because the input buffer is empty. You have to provide more input with SetInput(). NOTE: IsNeedingInput() also returns true when, the stream is finished.
IsNeedingDictionary() returns true, you have to provide a preset dictionary with SetDictionary().
IsFinished returns true, the inflater has finished.
Once the first output byte is produced, a dictionary will not be needed at a later stage.
Author of the original java version: John Leuner, Jochen Hoenicke

member.summary: Copy lengths for literal codes 257..285

member.summary: Extra bits for literal codes 257..285

member.summary: Copy offsets for distance codes 0..29

member.name: F:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Inflater.CPDEXT
member.summary: Extra bits for distance codes

member.name: T:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Streams.InflaterInputStream
member.summary:
This filter stream is used to decompress data compressed using the "deflate" format. The "deflate" format is described in RFC 1951.
This stream may form the basis for other decompression filters, such as the GZipInputStream.
Author of the original java version: John Leuner.

member.name: T:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Streams.StreamManipulator
member.summary:
This class allows us to retrieve a specified number of bits from the input buffer, as well as copy big byte blocks.
It uses an int buffer to store up to 31 bits for direct manipulation. This guarantees that we can get at least 16 bits, but we only need at most 15, so this is all safe.
There are some optimizations in this class, for example, you must never peek more than 8 bits more than needed, and you must first peek bits before you may drop them. This is not a general purpose class but optimized for the behaviour of the Inflater.
Authors of the original java version: John Leuner, Jochen Hoenicke

member.name: M:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Streams.StreamManipulator.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a default StreamManipulator with all buffers empty

member.name: M:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Streams.StreamManipulator.PeekBits(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the next sequence of bits but don't increase input pointer. bitCount must be less or equal 16 and if this call succeeds, you must drop at least n - 8 bits in the next call.
member.param: The number of bits to peek.
member.returns: the value of the bits, or -1 if not enough bits available. */

member.name: M:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Streams.StreamManipulator.DropBits(System.Int32)
member.summary: Drops the next n bits from the input. You should have called PeekBits with a bigger or equal n before, to make sure that enough bits are in the bit buffer.
member.param: The number of bits to drop.

member.name: M:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Streams.StreamManipulator.GetBits(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the next n bits and increases input pointer. This is equivalent to followed by , except for correct error handling.
member.param: The number of bits to retrieve.
member.returns: the value of the bits, or -1 if not enough bits available.

member.summary: Gets the number of bits available in the bit buffer. This must be only called when a previous PeekBits() returned -1.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.GeneralBitFlags.EnhancedCompress
member.summary: Bit 12 is documented as being reserved by PKware for enhanced compression.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.GeneralBitFlags.HeaderMasked
member.summary: Bit 13 if set indicates that values in the local header are masked to hide their actual values, and the central directory is encrypted.
member.remarks: Used when encrypting the central directory contents.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.GeneralBitFlags.ReservedPkware14
member.summary: Bit 14 is documented as being reserved for use by PKware

member.name: F:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.GeneralBitFlags.ReservedPkware15
member.summary: Bit 15 is documented as being reserved for use by PKware

member.summary: This class contains constants used for Zip format files

member.name: F:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipConstants.VersionMadeBy
member.summary: The version made by field for entries in the central header when created by this library
member.remarks: This is also the Zip version for the library when comparing against the version required to extract for an entry. See ZipEntry.CanDecompress.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipConstants.VERSION_MADE_BY
member.summary: The version made by field for entries in the central header when created by this library
member.remarks: This is also the Zip version for the library when comparing against the version required to extract for an entry. See ZipInputStream.CanDecompressEntry.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipConstants.VersionStrongEncryption
member.summary: The minimum version required to support strong encryption

member.name: F:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipConstants.VERSION_STRONG_ENCRYPTION
member.summary: The minimum version required to support strong encryption

member.name: F:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipConstants.VERSION_AES
member.summary: Version indicating AES encryption

member.name: F:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipConstants.VersionZip64

member.summary: Size of local entry header (excluding variable length fields at end)

member.summary: Signature for local entry header

member.summary: Signature for spanning entry

member.summary: Signature for spanning entry

member.name: F:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipConstants.SpanningTempSignature
member.summary: Signature for temporary spanning entry

member.name: F:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipConstants.SPANTEMPSIG
member.summary: Signature for temporary spanning entry

member.name: F:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipConstants.DataDescriptorSignature
member.summary: Signature for data descriptor
member.remarks: This is only used where the length, Crc, or compressed size isnt known when the entry is created and the output stream doesnt support seeking. The local entry cannot be 'patched' with the correct values in this case so the values are recorded after the data prefixed by this header, as well as in the central directory.

member.name: F:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipConstants.EXTSIG
member.summary: Signature for data descriptor
member.remarks: This is only used where the length, Crc, or compressed size isnt known when the entry is created and the output stream doesnt support seeking. The local entry cannot be 'patched' with the correct values in this case so the values are recorded after the data prefixed by this header, as well as in the central directory.

member.summary: Signature for central header

member.summary: Central header digitial signature

member.name: P:PdfEdit.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipConstants.DefaultCodePage
member.summary: Default encoding used for string conversion. 0 gives the default system OEM code page. Dont use unicode encodings if you want to be Zip compatible! Using the default code page isnt the full solution neccessarily there are many variable factors, codepage 850 is often a good choice for European users, however be careful about compatability.
